meanings.definition: To increase rapidly in value or price.
meanings.sent1: The demand for the new toy skyrockets during the holiday season.
meanings.sent2: The stock market skyrockets when positive news is announced.
meanings.sent3: The price of ice cream skyrockets in the middle of a heatwave.
meanings.sent4: Her excitement skyrockets when she hears about the surprise party.
meanings.sent5: The popularity of the singer skyrockets after the release of a hit song.

meanings.definition: A type of firework that shoots high into the sky before exploding.
meanings.sent1: The colorful skyrockets lit up the night sky during the celebration.
meanings.sent2: Children love watching the bright skyrockets on the Fourth of July.
meanings.sent3: The grand finale of the fireworks display featured dazzling skyrockets.
meanings.sent4: The skyrockets painted the sky with bursts of light and color.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the skyrockets echoed through the valley.

meanings.definition: A type of plant with bright yellow flowers.
meanings.sent1: The garden was filled with beautiful skyrockets swaying in the breeze.
meanings.sent2: She picked a bouquet of vibrant skyrockets to decorate the table.
meanings.sent3: The field was a sea of golden skyrockets under the summer sun.
meanings.sent4: The delicate petals of the skyrockets danced in the wind.
meanings.sent5: The fragrance of the skyrockets filled the air with sweetness.
